on this day in 1930, a mob of 500 white men and youth attacked filipino farmworkers in the town of watsonville in santa cruz county, california. over a period of five days, the mob burned down a dance club owned by a filipino man, hunted and violently assaulted filipinos in their homes, labor houses and on the streets. 22 - year - old fermin tobera, who was hiding with 11 others, was killed after the mob sprayed bullets into their bunkhouse. the attacks soon spread to other cities in california and filipinos became targets of intense violence amidst growing anti - immigration sentiments stoked by racist
